From the Messenger of Allah: Law (شرع) and Quran.
That is Islam, so act according to its ruling,
Just as it is faith (إيمان), just as it is excellence (إحسان).

**Connection:** Fulfilling rights (أداء الحقوق) is a Divine attribute demanded of the cosmos.

He, Exalted is He, said, <<He gave everything its creation (خلقه)>> (Q. 20:50). That is the essential right (حق ذاتي) that the thing has with Allah, derived from its essence (ذاته). The accidental right (حق عرضي) it has with Allah is His saying, <<I will fulfill My covenant (أُوفِ بِعَهْدِكُمْ)>> (Q. 2:40). This is a right upon Allah that He obligated upon Himself for whoever fulfills his covenant. Whoever does not fulfill it has no covenant with Allah; He may punish him if He wills, or admit him to Paradise if He wills. Some of Allah's servants enter Paradise by merit (الاستحقاق), and some enter it by Will, not by merit. Similarly, some enter the Fire by merit, specifically the criminals (المجرمون), who are its inhabitants and will never leave it. This is why they will be told on the Day of Resurrection, <<And stand apart today, O criminals (المجرمون)>> (Q. 36:59)—meaning, O people of merit who deserve to dwell in this abode. As for those other than the criminals, even if they enter the Fire, they must eventually leave it through the intercession of intercessors or by the grace of Allah upon them, such as those who never did any good whatsoever. Although the criminals may have done good, merit demands their permanent residence there, for their form is the form of one who acts by that inherent property. Whoever gives The Real His due from himself leaves no argument against himself for anyone. Whoever exceeds the due right, that is a distinction (امتياز) for him and special praise from Allah. This is an attribute about which the people of Allah have discussion, for in giving the obligatory, one is a servant of necessity (عبد اضطرار), and in showing grace, one is a servant of choice (عبد اختيار). Some people preferred the station of the servitude of choice over the servitude of necessity, for necessity is compulsion (جبر), and its ruling is different from that of the one who chooses. Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, said, <<Except one who is compelled (أُكْرِهَ) while his heart is firm in faith (الإيمان)>> (Q. 16:106). The one who is not compelled, if he disbelieves, is held accountable for his disbelief, and whatever he does, he is recompensed for his action, unlike the compelled one. The only remaining consideration is knowing who the compelled and coerced one is and what his description is. Some scholars did not accept compulsion and coercion regarding fornication, arguing that one is held accountable for it, because the organ only functions through the flow and ruling of lust (الشهوة) within it. In our view, he is compelled in such a case, coerced to desire the intercourse, and the ruling of his desire does not appear except through the occurrence, and the occurrence does not happen except after arousal and the existence of lust. At that point, he protects himself from the one who coerces him to do it, threatening him with death if he does not. Thus, coercion in such a matter is valid inwardly, unlike disbelief, where the outward is sufficient, even if the inward contradicts it. The fornicator desires and yet dislikes that lust, for he is a believer. Were it not that lust is a desire accompanied by pleasure, we would say that he does not desire what he lusts for.

Whoever lusts for a matter, we may see him
Not desiring what he lusts for.
But he was compelled, so he lusted for it,
In the outward appearance of the matter when he saw it.
So tell him to abstain, perhaps
Allah will benefit him when He protects him.
I have spoken a saying; if it is true,
Perhaps it will run its course.
Fulfilling rights is among the obligations,
Upon one who witnesses or one who is absent.
There are only rights, so whoever
Upholds them has upheld the obligation.
And whoever does not uphold the fulfillment of rights,
The Law (الشريعة) calls him an usurper.

**Connection:** When the possible (الممكن) exists, there must be a preserver (حافظ) to maintain its existence (وجوده).

By means of that preserver, its subsistence (بقاؤه) in existence continues, whatever that preserver may be among the cosmoses. Preservation (الحفظ) is a creation of Allah, so preservation is attributed to Him, because the entities subsisting by themselves (الأعيان القائمة بأنفسها) are receptive to preservation, unlike those possibles that do not subsist by themselves. These do not accept preservation; they accept existence but not subsistence (البقاء). They have no existence beyond the time of their existence, and then they cease to be. The object of preservation is the second moment that follows the moment of its existence, and whatever follows that. Allah is a Preserver (حفيظ) and an Observer (رقيب). The entity subsisting by itself is preserved and observed. The preserver of the cosmos is the preserver of the time of its existence. The Real is an Observer (مراقب) of the servant, but He is not preserved (محفوظ) by him, for He does not accept being preserved, as He is The Eternal Refuge (الصمد) who has no like. Do you not see that He said to His Prophet, peace be upon him, what He says to those who worship other than Allah, alerting them that everything besides Allah that is worshipped requires, by its essence, someone to preserve the continuity of its existence? So He said to him, O Muhammad, <<Say, 'Shall I take a protector (وليا) other than Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, while He feeds, but is not fed (يُطْعِمُ ولا يُطْعَمُ)?'>> (Q. 6:14). Every existent that has subsistence in its existence must have an existential preserver (حافظ كياني) that maintains its existence. That preserver is a creation of Allah, and it is the nourishment of this preserved existent. Its essence (عينه) remains, even if its form changes, as long as Allah nourishes it with what sustains its subsistence, whether subtle or dense, perceived or unperceived. The fortunate among the preservers is the one who sees that he is appointed for preservation. He, Exalted is He, said, <<Indeed, over you are guardians (لَحافِظِينَ)>> (Q. 82:10). These are not the preservers of existence; rather, they are the observers of the servants' actions. The general preservers are referred to in His saying, <<And He sends over you preservers (حَفَظَةً)>> (Q. 6:61). He used the indefinite form, which includes both the preservers of existence and the preservers of actions.

If you say that Allah preserves His creation,
It is nothing but His creation by which the preservation occurs.
This is the meaning that I intended,
And the wording of our expression points to it.
Do not utter what I said about it, for it
Will destroy you if you realize that wording.

**Connection:** The Pen (القلم) and the Tablet (اللوح) are the first world of religious practice (التدين) and inscription (التسطير).

Their reality (حقيقتهما) flows through all existents, high and low, conceptual and sensory. By means of them, Allah preserved knowledge (العلم) for the world. This is why it is reported in the Hadith from him, peace and blessings be upon him: "Restrict knowledge by writing it down."
From this perspective, Allah wrote the Torah with His Hand. And from this Presence (حضرة), the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and all the Messengers, peace be upon them, took the book of revelation (كتاب الوحي). He said, <<Noble recorders (كِراماً كاتِبِينَ), who know what you do>> (Q. 82:11-12). And He said concerning a book, <<It leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it>> (Q. 18:49). And He said, <<And everything We have enumerated in a manifest register (إِمامٍ مُبِينٍ)>> (Q. 36:12). And He said, <<in a hidden book (كِتابٍ مَكْنُونٍ)>> (Q. 56:78). And He said, <<In honored scrolls, exalted, purified, in the hands of scribes (سَفَرَةٍ)>> (Q. 80:13-15). Writing (*al-katb*) means joining (*al-ḍamm*). From this, the battalion (*al-katība*) is named *katība* because the soldiers join together. By the joining of the two spouses, marriage (*al-nikāḥ*) occurs in meanings and bodies, and results appear in the entities (الأعيان). Whoever preserves this specific joining (الضم الخاص) gains an elevation of what he did not possess. Whoever does not preserve this specific joining that yields knowledge will achieve nothing worthwhile, and his speech will be useless.

If there is production, there must be joining.
But not every existent comes from joining.
Whoever is below the Tablet (اللوح) and the Pen (القلم) which
Has the ruling over us by embracing and kissing.
There must be a cosmos that exists by its joining
To its Tablet, so the cosmos is in the degree of quantity (الكم).
And in quality (الكيف), look at what I have composed,
And be aware of it in this existence.

**Connection:** Know that Allah has gatherings (مجالس) with His servants.

Their number corresponds to the number of obligations (الفرائض) He initially imposed upon them. When He established them, He invited them to these gatherings to sit with Him. Whoever fails to attend His gathering in them has disobeyed His invitation. Allah has gatherings called the gatherings of faith (الإيمان). He sits with them in these gatherings in a special manner if they enter them from the perspective from which He invited them, and they find much good. If they enter them not from the perspective from which He invited them, He does not sit with them, nor do they find good or evil in them. The number of these gatherings corresponds to the number of things He permitted them in the Law (الشرع) to engage in, for which there is neither reward nor sin (مباح). If they perform the permissible act from the perspective that Allah, Exalted is He, permitted it to them, and they are believers in that, He is present with them through faith. This is the meaning of my saying, "from the perspective from which He invited them." Allah has gatherings within these permissible gatherings (مجالس الإباحة) where He sits with them if they come to them from the perspective from which He invited them to enter them. If they do not come to these specific gatherings within the permissible gatherings, and do not sit with The Real in them, they have disobeyed Him, and the ruling for abandoning His gathering in them is the same as the ruling for the obligatory gatherings (مجالس الفرائض). By "obligatory duties" (الفرائض), I mean everything I mention, whether action or abstention, so that it includes prohibition (الحظر) and dislike (الكراهة), which are the counterparts of recommendation (الندب). The number of these gatherings corresponds to the number of things they obligated upon themselves by vow (النذر), which Allah then obligated upon them, and the number of things their authorities commanded them, whose obedience Allah then obligated upon them. If they do not enter these gatherings, they have disobeyed. We only made these gatherings specific within the permissible gatherings because a vow is only made concerning what is permissible for one to do, where The Real gave them a choice between action and abstention. Likewise, what their authorities command them is only what is permissible for them to do. The Real sits with them in these specific gatherings just as He sits with them in the obligatory gatherings. Allah has gatherings that He prepared for His servants called the gatherings of supererogatory good deeds (نوافل الخيرات). The difference between them and the permissible gatherings is preference (الترجيح), for permissibility contains no preference. As we said regarding all of this, whether action or abstention, He coupled His high and sublime love for the people of the obligatory gatherings, and coupled another love, lesser than this, for the people of the supererogatory gatherings. The number of these gatherings corresponds to the number of supererogatory acts (النوافل). A supererogatory act is only one that has a counterpart in the obligatory duties, such as voluntary charity being supererogatory because it has an origin in the obligatory duties, which is *Zakat*. Likewise, Hajj, fasting, and every prayer and obligation. Allah has gatherings where The Real sits with His servants, called the gatherings of existential customs (السنن الكيانية), which is referred to in His saying, peace and blessings be upon him, "Whoever establishes a good practice (سنة حسنة)."
In common parlance, this is called a good innovation (*bid'a ḥasana*), because it is an innovation by the one who established it; Allah did not prescribe it for us nor make it obligatory. Their number corresponds to the number of such practices established, and the number of those who act upon them. All of this constitutes the sitting of The Real with the one who established it, without him realizing it, unless Allah unveils to him in his secret heart His sitting with him corresponding to the number of every person who acts upon it. He then sees his sitting as strange, as he is not performing the act at that moment. It is said to him, "So-and-so and so-and-so performed the good deed you established, so We sat with them, and thus We sat with you." So he praises his action and thanks Allah for that. Every gathering has a door (باب) through which entry to these gatherings occurs. On every door is a doorkeeper, which is faith (الإيمان). Some gatherings have two doorkeepers: faith and intention (النية). The doors are nothing but the commencement of that action, which is equivalent to entry. The state one is in at the beginning of the commencement, which is the entry, that is the door. He, Exalted is He, said, <<Those who are constant in their prayer (صَلاتِهِمْ دائِمُونَ)>> (Q. 70:23). The one who prays is intimately conversing (يناجي) with his Lord, and intimate conversation is remembrance (ذكر), and he is the companion of the One who remembers Him, Exalted is He. Constancy in intimate conversation means that the servant, in all his states and actions, is with Allah just as he is in his prayer, conversing with Him in every breath. The reason for this is that the servant must necessarily be in one state or another, and The Lawgiver, who is Allah, must necessarily have a ruling concerning that state, whatever ruling it may be. He, Exalted is He, is present with His rulings wherever they are. Thus, the levels (المراتب) converse with Him in every state, whether prohibited or not, because actions and abstentions, which are the servant's states to which the rulings of The Real are attached, are decreed and must occur. He, Exalted is He, is their Creator, so He must be present in them. This servant, who knows the presence of The Real with him in his state, converses with Him. This is constancy in prayer. Aisha reported concerning the state of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he used to remember Allah in all his times.
She points to what we have said, for he used to go to the privy, where he was forbidden to remember his Lord with his tongue in that state. And among his times, he would joke with the old woman and the child, and speak to the Bedouins, and in all these times, he was remembering. This is what is called the remembrance of the heart (ذكر القلب), which is distinct from verbal remembrance and imaginary remembrance. Whoever remembers Allah with this remembrance is His constant companion. He is the one whom his Lord praised and included among those <<who are constant in their prayer>>. When Allah interpreted prayer, He interpreted it only as remembrance, which is recitation. He said: The servant says, <<All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعالَمِينَ)>>. Allah says, "My servant has praised Me." Thus, He divided the intimate conversation between Himself and His servant. Intimate conversation (المناجاة) is the very essence of prayer, and intimate conversation is the act of two agents, for He says and the servant says. He, Exalted is He, said, <<So remember Me; I will remember you (فَاذْكُرُونِي أَذْكُرْكُمْ)>> (Q. 2:152).

If you recite the Book of Allah, you are by it
Among those who sit with Him and those who converse intimately with Him.
Prayer is nothing but the Wise Remembrance (الذكر الحكيم), so whoever
Recites it has prayed, and in it is some of what is in Him.
Because of the Opening Chapter of the Quran, I said to you
That it is in Him, and my remembrance does not contain Him.
So, praise (الحمد) is the obligation of the one praying in his recitation.
But not every one who prays perceives it.

**Connection:** The voluntary return (الرجوع الاختياري) to Allah is thanked by the servant.

He, the Mighty and Majestic, said, <<And to Him is returned the affair, all of it (الْأَمْرُ كُلُّهُ)>> (Q. 11:123). If you know this, then return to Him voluntarily, and do not return to Him under compulsion, for your return to Him is inevitable, and you must meet Him, whether you are averse or loving. He will meet you with your attribute, adding nothing to it. So look to yourself, O friend.

The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Whoever loves meeting Allah, Allah loves meeting him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, Allah dislikes meeting him."

We were informed in the unveiling (الكشف) by the Divine information breathed into the spirit (الروع) from the special aspect: "Whoever is ashamed of meeting Allah, Allah comforts him and removes his embarrassment." This is because nothing causes the servant to be ashamed except the manifestation of disobedience or falling short of the right of capability. There are only these two. The Real comforts him in this by saying to him, "O My servant, that was only by My decree (قضائي) and destiny (قدري). You are the locus for the flow of My ruling." The servant is comforted by this saying. If the servant were to say this saying to Allah, he would be ill-mannered toward Allah, and it would not be accepted from him. Yet, by this very thing, The Real comforts him. So, from the side of The Real, it is the height of goodness, and from the side of creation, it is the height of ugliness.

The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Modesty (الحياء) is entirely good." He also said, "Modesty brings nothing but good."

What greater good is there than this good: that The Real establishes the servant's argument as a comfort (أنس) to him, an intimacy (مباسطة), a removal of embarrassment, and a lifting of anxiety? Glory be to the Subtle, the All-Aware, the Benefactor, the Gracious! When this Divine definition came upon me, existence could not contain me; existence became too narrow for me because I was filled with this address and Divine definition, where He made me the locus of His address and qualified me for what He qualified His chosen ones for. We know that meeting Allah only occurs through death. We knew the meaning of death, so we hastened it in the worldly life. We died in the very essence of our life concerning all our actions, movements, and intentions. When death appeared upon us in our life—which never ceases from us, wherever we are, and by which our essences, limbs, and all our parts glorify Him—we met Allah, and He met us. Thus, we had the ruling of one who meets Him loving the meeting. When the commonly known death comes and the veil of this body is lifted from us, no state changes for us, nor do we increase in certainty beyond what we were upon. We tasted only the first death (الموتة الأولى), which we died in our worldly life. So our Lord protected us from the torment of the Hellfire, <<as a favor from your Lord. That is the great attainment (الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ)>> (Q. 44:57).

Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, said, "If the veil were lifted, I would not increase in certainty (يقينا)."

Whoever returns to Allah with this return is happy and does not perceive the inevitable, compulsory return, for he only came to it while he was already there, with Allah. The utmost that the commonly known death can do in his case is that his soul, which is with Allah, is prevented from managing this body that it used to manage. It remains with The Real in its state, and this body returns to its origin, which is the dust from which its essence arose. It becomes a dwelling that its inhabitant has departed from. The Angel settles him in <<a seat of truth (مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ)>> with Him, <<until the Day they are resurrected>> (Q. 36:59). His state in his resurrection will be the same; no state will change for him from being with The Real, not even in what The Real grants him with the breaths. Likewise, in the general gathering (الحشر العام) and in the Gardens (الجنان) that are his abode and dwelling, and in the existence (النشأة) in which he descends, he sees an existence created without precedent. This existence grants him in its manifestation what the inner reality and imagination (خيال) of this worldly existence grant. Thus, the outward action of the Hereafter's existence follows that ruling. He enjoys all his dominion in a single breath, and he loses nothing of his dominion—wives and others—permanently, nor does he lose them. He is among them as he desires, and they are in him as they desire, for it is an abode of swift reaction (انفعال سريع) without slowness, like the inner reality of this worldly existence in its corresponding thoughts. Thus, man in the Hereafter is an inverted existence (مقلوب النشأة): his inner reality is fixed upon one form, like his outward reality here, and his outward reality is swift in transformation of forms, like his inner reality here. He, Exalted is He, said, <<What kind of turning they will turn (أَيَّ مُنْقَلَبٍ يَنْقَلِبُونَ)>> (Q. 26:227). When we were turned, we were inverted, and nothing was added to the state we were upon. Understand this. This return mentioned in this connection is not the return of repentance (رجوع التوبة), for that return, called repentance, has a specific limit with the scholars of outward forms and with us. This is a general return in all the states that man is upon. This is the difference between the two returns. Repentance is a return with regret and resolve concerning a matter, but this is not so. Repentance is generally known, but this return is known in particular; only the people of Allah, who are truly themselves, attain it.

Indeed, the return is what is sought for Allah,
To Him, away from every cosmos that is in Him, by Allah.
So do not say to things, "You are not Him."
For there is nothing in the cosmos but Him and it.
So be with Allah in all states collectively,
And do not be heedless of the witnessing (شهود) of Allah.
For Allah has an eye that does not sleep.
By it, He sees you, and He witnesses nothing but Allah.
It is among the most wondrous matters that the affair is one.
So what are these divisions in our cosmoses?

**Connection:** Servitude (العبودية) is pure, sincere, essential abasement (ذلة محضة خالصة ذاتية) for the servant.

The servant is not charged with upholding it, for it is the very essence of his being (عين ذاته). If he upholds its right, his upholding is worship (*ibāda*). Only those who dwell in the vast Divine Earth (الأرض الإلهية الواسعة), which encompasses contingency (الحدوث) and eternity (القدم), uphold it. That is the Earth of Allah. Whoever dwells in it realizes the worship of Allah, and The Real attributes him to Himself. He, Exalted is He, said, <<O My servants (who have believed), indeed My earth is vast, so worship only Me (فَإِيَّايَ فَاعْبُدُونِ)>> (Q. 29:56). I have been worshipping Allah in it since the year 590 AH, and today I am in the year 635 AH. This Earth has subsistence; it is not the earth that accepts change. This is why He made it the dwelling of His servants and the locus of His worship. The servant remains a servant forever, so he remains in this Earth forever. It is a conceptual, intelligible Earth, not sensory, even if it appears in the senses, like the appearance of the Theophany (تجلي) of The Real in forms, and the Theophany of meanings in sensory objects. Meanings only appear in sensory forms because of the deficiency of some souls in perceiving what is not material. If a person is deeply versed in the Gnosis of Allah, he does not see meanings in materials, nor does he see materials outside of themselves. Thus, he perceives everything in its thingness, whatever it may be. This is the perception that is relied upon because it is free from confusion. It is not valid in any way for a person to witness his pure servitude (محض عبوديته) or to be established in his pure worship, which is unmixed with any Lordship (الربوبية) granted by the form upon which he was created, except through a Divine Theophany (تجلي إلهي). If there is no Theophany, the person is established in the form upon which he was created, so he is a servant and a lord, an owner and an owned, just like the common people. The difference between him and the common people is that the common people have belief, the scholars of outward forms have knowledge, and this group has witnessing (شهود). He is the mixed servant, manifesting both realities. Only the people of Divine care (أهل العناية) who inhabit this vast, endless Earth are freed from this mixture. Every other earth is limited and does not have this ruling. Therefore, its lords are many, for every servant has a dominion in it that he owns and manages, and no one else transgresses against him. By the very thing he owns of it, he is a lord and owner within it. This vast Earth is the one that manages its inhabitants and rules over them by its essence. It is the manifestation of Lordship (الربوبية) and the platform of the True Owner. In it, they see Him. Whoever belongs to its people is veiled from the form upon which he was created, so he is a pure servant, a witness who witnesses The Real in the very essence of his being. The witnessing is constant for him, and the ruling is necessary for him. These are the ones whose faces are blackened (مسودون الوجه) in this world and the Hereafter, if you understand that.

So the Lord is Lord, and the servant is servant.
So do not deceive, and do not mix.
Indeed, the Earth of Allah is vast.
So worship in it the One to whom it belongs.
Convey to Him in your worship
By what you hope for from His hope.
For what is His is for you, and what is mine
Is for you of an attribute that is not His.
And when He says, "I am not here."
He has established you as His like.
That is the meaning of vicegerency (الخلافة) in
His Earth, so traverse its paths by it.
And stand by the very essence of His form
In that for which He established you as His substitute.
And act at every moment
By what He showed you of His action.

**Connection:** Transitions in states (الأحوال).

This is an effect of His being, <<Every day He is in a [new] affair (شَأْنٍ)>> (Q. 55:29). The entire cosmos is upon this form, and it is nothing other than the affairs (الشئون) by which He appears. Only the people of states (أصحاب الأحوال) witness this matter by unveiling (كشفا). Only the people of spiritual journeys (أهل السياحات) witness this as a state (حالا). Only those who affirm the renewal of accidents (تجدد الأعراض) in every moment witness it by knowledge (علما). Some of Allah's servants, when they become known in a place, move from it to another place out of jealousy (غيرة) for Allah and for themselves. As for their jealousy for Allah, they are known only by Him, so their state is what The Real manifests to people, and they are jealous for the Divine Presence (الجناب الإلهي) because Allah is not remembered except through them. In reality, they should remember Allah only by Allah. When they saw that the matter appeared in reverse—which is His saying, peace be upon him, when asked who the friends of Allah are, "Those who, when they are seen, Allah is remembered"—they became jealous of this.
They desired to honor the Divine Presence so that people would remember Him initially, not because of seeing them. As for their jealousy for themselves, they did not realize The Real in their transformations by witnessing the affairs of The Real except so that creation would not know them, just as they do not know The Real. As long as they remain unknown in the world, their life is pleasant, and they know that Allah has made them hidden (أخفياء), innocent, protected in the most guarded shelter (الكنف الأحمى) among His treasures. Whenever they become known, they move, either by state (الحال)—which is acting according to customary rulings that are like habitual signs, known only to those who understand from Allah—or by sensory, spatial transition from place to place, due to their realization of The Real in His descent from heaven to heaven. Whoever wishes to enjoy the existence of this type of person, witness him, and benefit from him without him realizing it, should not show him that he knows him. He should manifest dignity and independence from him, and accompany him with the customary companionship of the common people, and not let a word appear from him that Allah would not approve, for the person of this state cannot tolerate it and will flee from him as he flees from one who knows him. He only deals with him concerning what is obligatory, recommended, or merely permissible. This is what their state requires.

Whoever witnesses The Real in His affairs,
The Real establishes him in His arts.
So he is knowledgeable of everything,
Which He made him witness from His manifestation.
He is the Imam whose light
Appears in the cosmos from his eyelids.
And everything you see as an entity,
That is only from his eyes.
They burst forth in hearts as knowledge,
As an entity and a truth leading to his certainty.
Glory be to the One whom none but I see,
Just as I see Him in His affairs.

**Connection:** The Barzakh state (الحالة البرزخية) is only established for those who magnify the sacred limits (حرمات الله) and the rituals (شعائر الله) of Allah among His servants, who are the people of Magnificence (أهل العظمة). I have not met anyone of this type except one man in Mosul, from Haditha of Mosul, who held this station (مقام). A difficult incident occurred to him, and he found no one to rescue him from it. When he heard of us, the one who believed in him, the jurist Najm al-Din Muhammad ibn Sha'i al-Mawsili, brought him to us. He presented his incident to us, and we rescued him from it. He was delighted and his heart was relieved, and we took him as a companion. He was one of the people of this station. I continued to strive to move him from it to what is higher, while remaining in his state. For transition (النقلة) in stations is not by abandoning the station, but by attaining what is higher than it without separating from the station you are in. It is a transition *to* such-and-such, not *from* such-and-such, but *with* such-and-such. This is how the people of Allah transition, and this is how the transition in meanings occurs. It is not necessary for one who transitions from one knowledge to another to be ignorant of the knowledge he was upon; rather, it remains with him if he was knowledgeable. The person of this state is between Allah and himself. He looks at himself to see his Lord from it or in it. If his object of desire does not appear to him, he turns his gaze by state toward his Lord to see himself in his Lord. When The Real sees him doing that, the Jealous Name (الاسم الغيور) comes to him, fearing that harm might reach him, so He returns him to the vision of himself and makes him witness his Lord in himself. This is the station that follows this one, if Allah wills.

It is from the Barzakh state (البرزخ) that he witnesses
Three signs that testify
That he has attained their entities (أعيانها),
And that by their knowledge, he is the master.
He rules in this and that by what
The witnessed state informed him of his condition.
So he is the approved Imam, and the one
For whom foreheads of intellects prostrate.
He is the one for whose sake prostration occurs,
And he is the one who prostrates, and the place of prostration.

**Connection:** Whoever witnesses his self with the witnessing of Reality (حقيقة)

He saw it as an eternal shadow of Him who is upon His form, yet it did not stand in His place, because the passive entity (المنفعل) does not stand in the place of its active agent (فاعله). Thus, shadows only prostrate due to the prostration of that from which they appeared. Shadows have no effect; rather, they are what is affected by it. And every passive entity has an active agent that is higher than it in degree (الرتبة). Therefore, things are witnessed only by their levels (مراتب), not by their immutable essences (أعيانها). For there is no difference between the king and the commoner in humanity. The cosmos (العالم) is distinguished only by levels, and the honor of one part over another is only due to them. Whoever knows that honor belongs to the levels and not to the entity itself does not deceive himself into thinking he is more honorable than others, even if he says that this level is more honorable than that level. This is the station (مقام) of the rational Gnostics (العقلاء العارفين). The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, often spoke in this station concerning himself and as a teaching for us: "I am only a human being like you." Thus, he saw no superiority for himself over us. Then he mentioned the level, which is his saying: "It is revealed to me." There is no disagreement among the rational that whoever exalts himself due to the honor of another is foolish and ignorant, since his honor is not inherent to himself. The matter is not so; the rational, present, witnessing person (الشهيد) sees no honor for himself by which he may boast over his peers.

Do you not see him, peace and blessings be upon him, when he said: "I am the master of mankind on the Day of Resurrection, and no boast!"

He negated the intention of boasting by that statement. Then he mentioned the level to which the boasting belongs, and of which he, peace and blessings be upon him, is the interpreter and the speaker by its tongue. He mentioned the level of Intercession (الشفاعة) and the Praised Station (المقام المحمود). Thus, the boasting belongs to the level, not to us. No man who knew his measure perished. And we, by the grace of God, have a firm footing (القدم الراسخة) in this station. The levels (المراتب) are non-existent relations (نسب عدمية), so there is no boasting by the Essence (بالذات) except for Allah alone. And if the boasting among us is due to the levels, and the levels are non-existent relations, then our boasting is only by non-existence (العدم). And suffice it for you concerning one whose boast is non-existence.

> If you understand what I have said, then you are the intended one, and you are the leader.
> And if you are ignorant of what I have said, then you are the ignorant one who is not sought after.
> For Knowledge (العلم) is the veil of radiance (السنا) for us, and ignorance (الجهل) is the veil of darkness for us.
> So say to the ignorant one concerning his states: You will know that at the time of death (الحمام).
> When Allah removes the covering from his eye, and the full moons (بدور التمام) become manifest.

### A Section: The Divine Command is Effective in the Commanded Entity

The Divine Command (الأمر الإلهي) is effective (نافذ) in the commanded entity (المأمور); the commanded entity does not halt for His command. When the Divine Command arrives upon the tongue of the cosmos (الكون), it appears in similitudes (الأمثال). The souls (النفوس) felt too proud to act under the commands of their likes. So they rejected the commands of The Real (الحق), either out of ignorance that they were the commands of The Real, or out of knowledge that they were the commands of The Real, but the intermediary (الواسطة) affected them. This is because the locus (المحل) returns the state within it to its own form, like water in vessels.

However, if the commanded entity is upon clear evidence from his Lord, he perceives that the commanded thing (المأمور به) is not within his power to bring into existence (إيجاد عينه) unless the Divine Command, which has efficacy (النفوذ), relates to it. Thus, he prepares his locus for the existence of the commanded thing when The Real brings it into existence. When he prepares his locus, The Real brings it into existence, and it is said of the locus that he is a servant obedient to Allah in what He commanded him. Yet the tongue of the state (لسان الحال) and Unveiling (الكشف) says: "You have no part in the command." And if he does not prepare his locus for the existence of the commanded thing, the commanded thing does not appear as an entity, and it is said: "A servant disobedient to his Lord's command, a transgressor." Yet the tongue of the state and Unveiling says to him: "You have no part in the command."

And whether the intermediary commands or speaks with a tongue of The Real or with a tongue other than The Real, this is an issue that has spread among the common people and is based on a corrupt principle. They say concerning the admonishers who fail to affect their listeners: "If the speech came from the heart, it would fall into the heart; if it came from the tongue, it would not pass the ears." By this, they imply that if the admonisher were truthful in what he calls people to God, it would have an effect. It is known that the Prophets and Messengers, peace be upon them, are truthful in their states; rather, they are the most truthful callers to Allah. Furthermore, they call to Allah upon clear insight (بصيرة) in the form of what was revealed to them, so they are truthful in every respect. Despite this, Noah, peace be upon him, said: <<إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا ونَهاراً فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعائِي إِلَّا فِراراً>> (Indeed, I called my people night and day, but my calling only increased their flight). And He said: "But when a warner came to them"—meaning the call of The Real upon the tongue of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him—<<ما زادَهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُوراً اسْتِكْباراً في الْأَرْضِ>> (it only increased them in aversion and arrogance in the land).

So do not deceive yourself. Look at what you are called to; if it is The Truth (حق), even if it comes from a devil, accept it. For you only accept The Truth, and you do not care who brought it. This is the goal of the Men (الرجال) who know things by The Real, not those who know The Real by things. Those who possess this description are the Gnostics (العارفون) who possess perfect knowledge (المعرفة التامة) of the Divine Scales (الموازين الإلهية). They are few in the world. Up to this time, I have not seen a single one of them, or if I have seen him, I have not seen him in the state of his activity (تصرفه) in this station. They are the sages (حكماء) of this Path, speaking by Allah, on behalf of Allah, concerning what Allah commanded them.

> For Allah has a group among His creation, whose hearts are devoted to Him.
> And they have no quality in their states that turns them away from what He has called them to.
> When He calls them by their breaths, He sees them standing at His door.
> They hasten to the command from their very being, knowing Him who called them to it.

### A Section: When a Judgment of Existence is Attributed to Other than Allah

If a judgment (حكم) from the judgments of Existence (أحكام الوجود) is attributed to other than Allah, the People of Witnessing (أهل الشهود) specifically deny it. They are those who do not witness or see anything except that they see Allah before it, as the Veracious One (الصديق) said of himself. As for the scholars (العلماء), in this station, they follow the ruling of The Real concerning it, not what they witness. Thus, they deny the indefinite (النكرة) and affirm the definite (المعرفة), since Existence (الوجود) is founded upon definition, and that is the origin. When similitudes (الأمثال) and likenesses (الأشباه) came, indefiniteness (التنكير) appeared, and we became dependent on apposition (البدل), qualification (النعت), and explanatory conjunction (عطف البيان). Were it not for the similitudes and the occurrence of indefiniteness, we would not need anything.

The essential definitions (الحدود الذاتية) of things do not possess the strength of qualifications. For example, the essential definition of man, qua man, does not distinguish Zayd from Amr. Therefore, there must be an addition by which this indefiniteness is defined. If you said, "A man came to me," it would not be known who he is until you say, "So-and-so." If he is in the Presence of Indefiniteness (حضرة التنكير), you qualify him, or substitute for him, or define him by explanatory conjunction, until you establish him in the Presence of Definition (حضرة التعريف) so that the one informed knows whom you intended. This is a station that no one has realized like the Malamiyya (the Blameworthy Ones) among the People of Allah, who are the masters of this Path.

And among people are those who deny The Real, not in the sense of objecting to Him, but rather seeking thereby to know the true state of the matter, which they were ignorant of, through the Divine Definition (التعريف الإلهي) <<لا يَأْتِيهِ الْباطِلُ من بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ ولا من خَلْفِهِ تَنْزِيلٌ من حَكِيمٍ حَمِيدٍ>> (Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it; [it is] a revelation from a Wise, Praiseworthy One), upon <<لِمَنْ كانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وهُوَ شَهِيدٌ>> (whoever has a heart or lends an ear while he is a witness). And from this station is my saying:

> I said to Him who creates what He creates: Why do You not preserve what You create?
> He replied to me: Indeed, the locus (المحل) that I create is narrow in itself.
> It accepts formation (التكوين) only thus. So be silent, for the door is not closed.
> The Entity (العين) is but one, everlasting. So do not worry that it is absolute.
> I renew the formation in its entity, while people are in confusion, so do not speak.
> Their sights are behind the veil of similitude (المثل); therefore, illusion (الوهم) precedes them.
> So inhale the fragrance from their turning away, for it is the musk that is fragrant.
> Look at the Originator of their entities: He is nothing other than this, realize it!
> For everything that is seen, its structure is related to a form in our Essence (ذاتنا).
> Their spirits (أرواحهم) are the nourishment of their bodies (أشباحهم), and their Spirit (روحهم) is related to my fruit.

### A Section: The Divine Essential Definitions

The Divine Essential Definitions (الحدود الذاتية الإلهية) by which The Real (الحق) is distinguished from Creation (الخلق) are known only by the People of Vision (أهل الرؤية), not the People of Witnessing (أهل المشاهدة) or others. They are not known through transmitted report (الخبر), but they may be known through necessary knowledge (علم ضروري) that Allah grants to whomever He wills among His servants, which is not attached to the Divine Report. There is no matter that is not grasped through the Divine Report except this one. Everything else is known only through the Divine Report or necessary knowledge, nothing else.

The definitions of existing things (الموجودات), despite their differences, are the definitions of the possible things (الممكنات) in terms of their judgments in the existential entity (العين الوجودية). The essential definition of the existential entity is nothing but the entity of its being existent, so its existence is the very entity of its reality, since the known thing (المعلوم) has no existence originally. The utmost goal of the Gnostics (العارفين) is to make the definitions of the entire cosmos (الكون بأسره) the Essential Definition (الحد الذاتي) of the Necessary Existent (واجب الوجود).

The Scholars of Allah (العلماء بالله) are above this Unveiling (الكشف) and Witnessing (المشهد), as we mentioned before. They, may Allah be pleased with them, guard this station because of how quickly it slips from their hearts. For whoever does not have Vision (الرؤية) constantly accompanying him with every breath is not one of these Men (الرجال). This is the station of one who says, "I saw nothing but Allah." If he is asked, "Who is the seer?" he says, "He is." If he is asked, "Who is the speaker?" he says, "He is." If he is asked, "Who is the questioner?" he says, "He is." If he is asked, "What is the matter?" he says, "Relations (نسب) appearing in Him, from Him, for Him. There is nothing there in 'there' but Him, and He is the very entity of 'there'." This is the witnessing (مشهد) of Abu Yazid al-Bistami, may Allah be pleased with him, by state (بالحال).

> Indeed, Allah has limits (حدودا) that were known by my existence, and by them, He was known.
> If anyone among His creation saw them, as I witnessed them, he would not turn away.
> No one sees what I have said except the one who has always been qualified by his Lord.
> Or one who is knowledgeable through decisive proof concerning my existence, or a just sage.

And among those who know The Real is he for whom The Real is his hearing, his sight, and all his powers. Among his powers is the knowledge of things, and The Real is that power, and the servant is described by it. Thus, he is described by The Real, and The Real knows Himself. This servant knows Him from the perspective that The Real is the very entity of his attribute, so he only knows Him by Him. And whoever possesses this station of knowledge of Allah, no one can compete with him in his knowledge of Allah. This is the one who knows the Essential Definition (الحد الذاتي) that cannot be spoken.

I saw in Konya, in one of the places of witnessing, a divine person called Saqit al-Rafraf (The Fallen of the Canopy), the son of Saqit al-Arsh (The Fallen of the Throne). And I saw in Fez a person who was lighting the furnace, one of those who had fallen. I accompanied him, and he benefited from us. Indeed, a group of the People of Allah turn away from the fallen (الساقطين). The reason for this is that they have not reached the level of Gnosis (معرفة الله) where they see Him as the very entity of everything. When they confined Him (to a specific concept), anyone who fell from that Divine Station (المقام الإلهي) which they had designated, they turned away from him, believing him to be far from Allah the Exalted. The Scholars of Allah (العلماء بالله) do not have this state of turning away from these people, because in the state of permanence (الثبوت) and the state of falling (السقوط), they have not departed from the Divine Station, even if they have departed from the station of felicity (المقام السعادي). The falling has no effect on them. Thus, they approach every fallen person with the acceptance of mercy or the acceptance of knowledge and gnosis, because they know where he landed when he fell, or who it is that fell. Allah has lifted the accountability from them and from those who were with Him. This is one of the greatest forms of Divine Care (العناية) for those who understand Allah through them, though they themselves are unaware, and no one is aware of them except the Scholars of Allah. The Exalted said: <<وما تَسْقُطُ من وَرَقَةٍ>> (And not a leaf falls)—and it only falls out of fear of Allah, just as He said: <<وإِنَّ مِنْها لَما يَهْبِطُ من خَشْيَةِ الله>> (And indeed, among them are those that fall down from fear of Allah). Falling (الهبوط) is a rapid descent without choice, and compulsion (الجبر) is the origin. This judgment of the origin has appeared in the fallen ones.

> When the star falls from its faces, and the falling is upon its face,
> It was only so that it might know, when it descended to the lower realm, its own essence (كنهه).
> So that it may know its Lord from itself, just as a likeness is known from its likeness.

### A Section: The Men of Allah Who Guard Their Souls

As for the Men of Allah (رجال الله) who guard their souls (نفوسهم) from the rule of the sovereign of heedlessness (سلطان الغفلة) that intervenes between them and the vigilance (المراقبة) they were commanded to maintain, they are of two types. One type has absolute freedom (الإطلاق) in guarding, like the absolute application of the legal ruling (حكم الشرع) to the actions of the legally responsible person. The second type has restriction (التقييد) in guarding, outwardly but not inwardly.

As for the People of Absolute Freedom, some of them guard what The Real designated for them as His capacity, which is the heart (القلب). And some of them maintain adherence to the veil (الحجاب), knowing that The Real is behind it. Thus, he is like the chamberlain (الحاجب) in the world, executing His commands. This is the state of the Pole (القطب). He has from Allah only the attribute of Address (الخطاب), not Witnessing (الشهود), because he is the master of the Divine Register (الديوان الإلهي). He remains only from behind a veil until he dies. When he dies, he meets Allah, being responsible for the world, and the world is responsible for him. This is the station of the Messengers, peace be upon them all.

Those who share in this station are those who maintain the obligatory prayers in congregation when able, and the abundance of supererogatory prayers (النوافل) by night and day. Since they knew that Allah is <<عَلى‏ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ حَفِيظٌ>> (Guardian over everything), and they are among the things, and they are those who claimed to be the People of the Archetypal Form (أهل الصورة المثلية), it was incumbent upon them to stand in this Attribute so that the Name 'The Guardian over everything' might be truly applied to them. Thus, they guard the rights that Allah has reserved for Himself in His dominion, rights over which no one in their world may contend with Him. And they act as deputies for the entire world concerning what is beneficial for them, due to the heedlessness and ignorance that characterize the world. Through ignorance, one does not distinguish his benefits from his harms; and through heedlessness, he neglects his benefits, even if he knows them when alerted. Thus, this servant, the Guardian over everything, deserves this Name. Since he knows that he has a guardian from Allah who records his actions, he guards what is dictated to him so that his scroll achieves distinction over all other scrolls when they are raised to Allah. This is the concern of the People. As for me, I say:

> Say to him who guards the affairs upon himself: Indeed, The Guardian (الحفيظ) guards Existence (الوجود).
> And for this reason, when the guarding comes, and he comes to what angers him,
> He stands alone, and affairs crowd him, so he is seen to be choked by their crowding.
> I asked, "Who crowds the affairs?" They said, "It is a coarse heart, harsh upon him."

When I saw what is proper for Allah and what is proper for the servant, and I saw what Allah veiled His servants, who are attributed to Him, with—in that He placed in their hearts the belief that they possess real Names, and that The Real, Exalted is He, has contended with them in those Names—and He veiled them from the knowledge that those Names belong to Him, Exalted is He. They contended with Him by embodying the Divine Names (التخلق بالأسماء الإلهية) and met contention with contention. They did not realize that which He did not contend with them over: the lowliness (الذلة) and destitution (الافتقار) to which Abu Yazid was alerted. We have Divine Care (عناية) from Allah. These are their Names, not what I claim. So they contended with Him over the Names they imagined belonged to them, while they were unaware. I was indeed like them in that before Allah favored me with the Gnosis He bestowed upon me. He taught me that the Names are His Names, and that they must necessarily be applied to us. So we applied them out of necessity, not belief. I, and those whom Allah singled out with this knowledge, applied them to Allah by belief (اعتقادا). Others applied them out of faithful necessity (اضطرارا إيمانيا) because the Law (الشرع) came with them, not by belief. So we guarded for Him what is His when they did not guard it, and He dealt subtly (مكر) with His servants. Concerning this, I said:

> If a creature among His creation were to resemble Him, my heart would resemble Him, but His might prevented it.
> So I said to the heart, "Do not be veiled by His form," but it did not answer, nor did it listen, nor did it hear.
> My heart called Him, and He answered its need. His might was His saying, "Here I am," when it called.
> If my heart knew what I say to it concerning what it seeks from Him, it would not be ambitious.
> But it is ignorant of the origin, distressed. So when what enriched it came, it said, "He called."

Whoever guards his own lowliness and destitution, and guards for Allah all His Names with which He described Himself and which were granted in Unveiling (الكشف) as belonging to Him, has been just, and is thus described as being <<عَلى‏ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ حَفِيظ>> (Guardian over everything).

### A Section: When Allah Opened the Door of the Two Mercies

When Allah opened the door of the Two Mercies (الرحمتين), and the dawn became clear by them for the one with two eyes, The Real made whomever He willed among His servants stand before Him and addressed him, informing him of what was for him and what was against him. He said to him: "If you do not fear Allah (تتق الله), you are ignorant of Him; and if you fear Him, you are more ignorant of Him. You must inevitably have one of these two qualities." For this reason, I created heedlessness (الغفلة) for you, so that you may be stripped of the judgment of the two opposites, and forgetfulness (النسيان), because without heedlessness, the judgment of one of them would appear. So thank Allah for heedlessness and forgetfulness.

Then it was said to him: "Beware of the People of Veils (أهل الستور) lest they lure you into them, for they are people of deception and subtlety. Should there be a veil over Him who is closer to you than <<حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ>> (the jugular vein)? He is only veiled from you by you. You are the very entity of His veil over you. If you saw your inner self (باطنك), you would see Him." Likewise, the two-faced person (ذو الوجهين) has a face with you and a face with Him, which confuses you. So beware of him just as you beware of the veil. They made themselves a veil; I did not take them as veils. If you see someone calling you to Me, those are My proofs (حجتي). So listen to them, for they have advised you sincerely and spoken truthfully to you.

Then it was said to him: "Allah was only named The Wise (الحكيم) for your sake, and He was named The All-Knowing (العليم) for your sake and for His sake." He has singled you out with a matter that is not His, but is yours. Thus, you have a greater comprehensiveness (إحاطة) in the Attributes than He, because you share in everything that is His, so He is not singled out by anything without you—and that is the perfection (كمال) proper to Him. And you are singled out by a matter that is not His—and that is your perfection proper to you and not proper to Him. Thus, there is nothing there but perfection within perfection.

Then it was said to him: "Follow the Report (الخبر), and do not follow speculation (النظر) stripped of the Report, for Allah was only named The All-Aware (الخبير) for this reason." Then it was said to him: "Rely upon Him, Exalted is He, in your agency (وكالتك), and beware of being an agent (وكيلا) for Him." Then it was said to him: "You are the heart of the world (قلب العالم), and He is your heart. So He honored you by Him, and He honored the world by you."

Then it was said to him: "Do not be ignorant of Him to whom you belong and who belongs to you, just as you are not ignorant of Him from whom you originate and who originates from you. Likewise, do not make Him who originates from you the one to whom you belong." And proceed with the Realities (الحقائق) according to what they are in themselves. If you do not do this and say otherwise, the witnessing of the Realities will belie you, and you will be among the liars. This is false speech (قول الزور), because it is a statement that inclines its speaker away from The Truth (الحق) upon which the matter stands, and deviates from justice (العدل).

Then it was said to him: "Let what you witness be what you intend, so that you may know what you intend. If you strive (اجتهدت) and err after striving, there is no blame upon you, and you are not held accountable. For Allah only burdens a soul with what He has given it, and it has fulfilled the portion Allah granted it. He is the one who veiled what He veiled by His wisdom, and unveiled what He unveiled by His wisdom, out of mercy to His servants."

Then it was said to him: "The Real is more deserving of His servants who are attributed to Him and distinguished from others. They are those who have always been His servants in the state of necessity (الاضطرار) and the state of choice (الاختيار) from their souls. He is not with those who are not attributed to Him in this manner. For every world (عالم) there is a known portion (حظ معلوم) from Allah, which does not exceed its division."

Then it was said to him: "If you bestow a kindness (معروفا), bestow it only upon a known one (لمعروف), and you know who the known one is. For kindness has people worthy of it (أهلا) whom none knows except Allah and those whom Allah informs."

Then it was said to him: "You have known that Allah has two covenants (ميثاقين), and you are required by both. Indeed, the scholars are the inheritors of the Prophets. So look at whom you inherit. If you inherit all of them, you are obliged to act according to the covenant of all of them. If you are the inheritor of a specific one, then you belong to the one you inherited."

Then it was said to him: "Be truthful, and do not feel secure."

Then it was said to him: "If you mention the blessings (النعم), you belong to them and are a servant of the blessing (عبد نعمة). If you mention Allah, you belong to Him and are a servant of Allah (عبد الله). If you mention both matters, you are a servant of the Bestower of Blessings (عبد المنعم) and a servant of Allah. You are the sage of the time. If you are not called 'Servant of the Bestower of Blessings,' know that you are specifically the servant of the Bestower of Blessings. So pay attention to which name of the names of attributed servitude (أسماء إضافة العبودية) you are called by from your secret, and be wary of it."

Then it was said to him: "Allah has a hidden compulsion (قهرا خفيا) in the world that is not perceived, which is what He compels them to in their choice (اختيارهم). And a manifest compulsion (قهرا جليا), which is what they have no choice in, and which rules over them." The Men of Allah (رجال الله) observe the hidden compulsion, because it is concerning this that the questioning and demand from Allah occur. If you witness compulsion (الجبر) in your choice, you are among those who witness the manifest compulsion, and that witnessing lifts the demand from you. However, the one who witnesses this is rare. I have seen few of the people of this tongue and state; indeed, I have seen only one in Syria, and I rejoiced in him.

Then it was said to him: "You have six directions: four of them belong to Satan, one belongs to you, and one belongs to Allah. In that which belongs to Allah, you are protected (معصوم). From there, take the reception (التلقي), and beware of the remaining five." For this reason, the Law (الشرع) came with five rulings, covering your direction and the directions of Satan from you. As for His direction from you, there is no ruling of the Law concerning it; it is a protected direction from which only Divine Sciences (العلوم الإلهية), preserved from admixture, descend upon the heart.

Then it was said to him: "If you are a believer (مؤمنا), be knowledgeable (عالما) so that doubts (الشبه) do not shake you. And no knowledge is such that doubts do not shake its possessor, except that which is from Allah. Every knowledge from other than Allah is contended with by doubts and uncertainties at times."

Then it was said to him: "Let no station (مقام) restrict you, for you are Muhammadan, so do not be an inheritor of anyone else; gather all the wealth." For whoever inherits him (Muhammad) from his community surpasses the rest of the Prophets in outward form, because they only witnessed him inwardly when they received their messages from him. Just as those who attained his outward Law (شريعته الظاهرة), like Jesus and Elias, are distinguished over the rest of the Prophets. For these two, the Muhammadan Station (المقام المحمدي) was perfected.

Then it was said to him: "Seeking permission (الاستئذان) for good is a sign of weakness (الفتور) and desire (الرغبة). If you seek permission from your Lord for a good deed that you know is good, then look: if He answers you by commanding you to do it, that is good. But if He gives you a choice, He has dealt subtly (مكر بك) with you and lured you gradually (استدرجك). If no answer occurs to you from Him, know that there is a flaw (ثلمة) in your faith. For you only knew it was good through the Lawgiver (الشارع), and the Lawgiver is Allah. Why then do you seek permission after knowing? Renew your faith before Him and say: 'There is no god but Allah, Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. I believe in what came from You,' and begin the action. Never seek permission for anything, for Allah is a Watcher (رقيب) over you, and He inspires you with what is beneficial for you. The scale of the Law (ميزان الشرع) that was legislated for you is in your hand; do not put it down for a single hour or a single breath. Rather, the People of Allah (أهل الله) are constantly weighing their state with every breath; they are the discerning money-changers (الصيارفة النقاد)."

Then it was said to him: "You are upon your dominion, and you will depart from your dominion, leave your land, and move on from the world. So do not neglect your provision (الزاد), for you only eat what you carry with you, and you only drink what you lift with you in your waterskin. The path is thirst-inducing, and the lands are barren."

Then it was said to him: "Do not increase your covenants (العهود); what you were compelled to is sufficient for you." For this reason, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, disliked vows (النذر) but made their fulfillment obligatory, because they are among the superfluities (فضول) of man. Just as excessive questioning (السؤال) was what destroyed the nations before this community, due to their superfluities, for questioning necessitates the revelation of rulings. And likewise, what occurred in this community regarding the establishment of analogical reasoning (القياس) and opinion (الرأي). The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, loved to minimize the legal obligations (التكليف) upon his community, but through analogy, they undoubtedly increased, thus occupying themselves with what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, disliked. Yet they have a reward for this, because they erred in their striving (اجتهاد) to establish analogy, without a doubt. So Allah benefits them by what they intended. As for the rest of the community, they are only bound by what came from Allah and His Messenger. Regarding what came from opinion or analogy, they have a choice. If they follow it and imitate its author, they have only imitated what the Lawgiver established as a ruling concerning that person. There is consideration in this, for we were only commanded to ask the People of Remembrance (أهل الذكر), and they are the People of the Quran. Allah the Exalted says: <<إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ>> (Indeed, We have sent down the Remembrance), meaning the Quran.

Then it was said to him: "Do not travel any path except that in which you find benefit and profit, for it is a trade. Allah named it thus when He said: <<هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلى‏ تِجارَةٍ تُنْجِيكُمْ من عَذابٍ أَلِيمٍ>> (Shall I guide you to a trade that will save you from a painful punishment?). Then He mentioned faith (الايمان) and striving (الجهاد). And He said: <<فَما رَبِحَتْ تِجارَتُهُمْ>> (Their trade did not profit) concerning those who exchanged guidance for error."

Then it was said to him: "You must seek refuge with Him whom you know cannot be resisted, for He will protect you."

Then it was said to him: "You must follow the traces of the Prophets, for they are the paths of the guided."

Then it was said to him: "Beware of envy (الحسد), for it consumes good deeds, and its ill consequence first returns upon its possessor."

Then it was said to him: "Divine Facilitation (التيسير الإلهي) is not among the attributes of The Real unless The Real appears in the form of its people. For the contender with Allah in bringing the possible into existence is the essential non-existence (العدم الذاتي) belonging to the possible. So look at what removes it. The essential matter (الأمر الذاتي) rules for itself, so strive to exit this doubt (الشبهة)."

Then it was said to him: "Allah created the world in phases (أطوارا), and every phase disdains its own phase, blames it, and praises what is other than it. What called for that? And what made everyone rejoice in what he possesses, to the extent that this joy prevented him from leaving it?"

Then it was said to him: "Emulation (الاقتداء) is the concern of the Men. So emulate Allah in that the Scale (الميزان) is in His hand. If you miss this emulation, you perish."

Then it was said to him: "Faith (الايمان) is an Isthmus (برزخ) between Islam (submission) and Ihsan (perfection), which is surrender (الاستسلام). For this reason, there can be Islam without faith, and faith without surrender. Adhere to surrender, and you will win everything. There is no Isthmus that possesses the strength of both sides except faith. Every Isthmus that contains the strength of both sides is faith."

Then it was said to him: "Attach the later (المتأخر) to the former (المتقدم), and you will be felicitous. Do not reverse the matter."

Then it was said to him: <<لا تَبْدِيلَ لِخَلْقِ الله>> (There is no altering of the creation of Allah). And the creation of Allah is His Words (كلماته). And <<لا تَبْدِيلَ لِكَلِماتِ الله>> (There is no changing of the Words of Allah). Change (التبديل) belongs to Allah only from the perspective of His being a Speaker (متكلما), not from the perspective of His being a Utterer (قائلا). If the utterance (القولة) appears in the form of the Word (الكلمة), it is not changed because it is an utterance, not from the perspective that it is a word from speech.

Then it was said to him: "Recompense (الحزاء) for good is certain, but for evil, it is subject to the Will (المشيئة)."

Then it was said to him: "Reliance upon the Strong One (القوي) is a sanctuary (حمى) that cannot be violated, so the one who seeks to violate it returns as a loser."

Then it was said to him: "Descent (النزول) from highness (العلو) occurs with sending down (إنزال) and without sending down. Whoever descends without sending down is praised. Whoever descends with sending down may be praised. The Caliphate (الخلافة) is the highest of degrees and possesses highness. Whoever strips himself of it is praised, even if he is in it. And whoever is stripped of it may be praised, depending on what happens to him."

Then it was said to him: "If you are an inheritor, you only inherit The Real (الحق)." He asked: "And how is The Real inherited?" He replied: "When The Real makes you witness His independence (غناه) from the worlds, He has abandoned them. This is a Divine inheritance (تركة إلهية) that only you inherit if you are the possessor of this witnessing (الشهود). Through this inheritance, you will know things about the world that you did not know before."

Then it was said to him: "Do not mix matters, and place everything where its reality (حقيقته) has placed it. So do not say, 'There is nothing there but Allah,' even if it is so—and it is so. Have not the intelligible levels (المراتب المعقولة) distinguished between its being such-and-such and its being thus-and-so? The Entity (العين) is one, as you say, but He is a matter from this perspective and another matter from that perspective. I see you feeling pain and fleeing from it. What called you to that from which you flee? And I see you feeling pleasure, and I see you lacking what you sought. By this measure, establish your entity and know your location. In any case, multiplicity (الكثرة) exists, and others (الأغيار) are witnessed: knowledgeable and ignorant, commander and commanded, ruler and ruled over, ruled by, and ruled in, willing and willed, choice and compulsion (جبر), separator and separated, joiner and joined, near and nearer, promise and threat. The benefit lies in the addresser, the addressed, the address, and the subject of the address. Man is one in his totality, yet his limbs are distinct and his powers are manifold, and he is himself, nothing else. If any part of him feels pain, the pain spreads throughout his whole. Yet you see one person suffering pain, another rejoicing in his pain, and another grieving over it. If the matter were one, as it is in man, the pain would spread throughout the entire world if one part suffered. The matter is not as you imagined. When the veil (الغطاء) is lifted, you will know what I say. So advise yourself if you wish to join the Scholars of Allah (العلماء بالله) whom Allah has made felicitous. The manifest (الظاهر) belongs to Allah, and the inner (الباطن) is like the spirit and the body; just as they do not separate, so too they do not separate. The matter is nothing but servant and Lord. It is nothing but you and Him. The obedient one is guided, and the disobedient one is confused between what was willed for him and what he was commanded.

### That Allah Married the Intellect to the Soul to Manifest Offspring, Not to Achieve the Pleasure of Cohabitation

Know that when Allah married the Intellect (العقل) to the Soul (النفس) to manifest the offspring, not to achieve the pleasure of cohabitation, He settled it in the land of Nature (الطبيعة). Thus, it affected its temperament (مزاجها), since the earth transforms what is sown in it into its own nature. Pay attention to His saying, Exalted is He: "It is irrigated with one water," and the earth is one, yet the tastes, scents, and colors differ. If we say that honey is sweet and delicious, you see some temperaments suffering pain from it and not finding pleasure, finding it bitter. Likewise with scents and colors. So we saw that this difference returns to the perceptions (الإدراكات), not to the things themselves. Thus, we saw them as relations (نسب) that have no reality in their entities (أعيانها) except in terms of their substance (جوهرها).

Then it was said to him: "Stop at the attributions (الإضافات) and relations (النسب), and you will stumble upon the matter as it truly is."

Then it was said to him: "If Allah makes you a sign (أيه الله بك), know from where you were called, where you were, why you were called, who called you, and what He called you. Then be according to what results for you from what I have mentioned."

Then it was said to him: "Felicity (السعادة) is in faith (الايمان), not in knowledge (العلم), and perfection (الكمال) is in knowledge. If you combine the two, then you are truly you; there is no goal above you."

Then it was said to him: "This is the Presence of Reports (حضرة الأخبار). Pay attention to every report that comes to you in it, for if you lose it, you will not attain in any other presence what you attain in it. And in it are sciences that I shall mention to you, if Allah wills."

Among these is the science of where the command and prohibition, and all rulings and conventional (الوضعية) and Divine laws (النواميس الإلهية), originated. And in it is the science of alerting to the realities of things through explicit statement, implication, and allusion. And in it is the science of the creation of man's inner self (باطن الإنسان) without his outer self, and how many 'man' entities there are in Existence. If you know that there are only three 'man' entities in Existence: the First Man, the Ancient Totality (الإنسان الأول الكل الأقدم); the World Man (الإنسان العالم); and the Adamic Man (الإنسان الآدمي). Then look at which of these three is the most complete (الأتم). And in it is the science of what is known only through faith. And in it is the science of balancing (الموازنة). And in it is the science of what intention (القصد) affects in matters that are not intended. And in it is the science of cohesion (الالتحام). And in it is the science of the Divine Registers (الدواوين الإلهية), the Book, the workers, and the disposers (المتصرفين). And in it is the science of conditions, testimonies, and judgments (القضايا) scattered throughout the world. And in it is the science of the accountability of the Register's workers. And in it is the science of movement and stillness. And in it is the science of the Absolute (الإطلاق) that has no restriction; yet when he who knows it knows it, he becomes restricted by it. And in it is the science of inclination and moderation, and by which of them formation (التكوين) occurs. And in it is the science of the specific properties (الخواص) in man, which is the unknown nature (الطبيعة المجهولة). And in it is the science of neglect (الإهمال) and respite (الإمهال), and which Names undertake that, and His saying: <<قُلْ ما يَعْبَؤُا بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْ لا دُعاؤُكُمْ>> (Say: My Lord would not care for you were it not for your prayer). And in it is the science of Divine Warfare. And in it is the science of Divine Withholding (المنع الإلهي), which contradicts Absolute Generosity (الجود المطلق): did He necessitate it from His necessity for His Essence, or for another matter? And in it is the science of the infallibility (عصمة) of the Messengers. And in it is the science of the diversification of the world: from where did it accept it, and what originated in what the rational proof (الدليل العقلي) gives, except from Him who does not accept diversification? And in it is the science of the Prophets, the Saints (الأولياء), and the rational ones (العقلاء), and the differences between them. And in it is the science of the wisdom of temporal, existential, spatial, and hierarchical precedence and delay. And in it is the science of acceptance and rejection. And in it is the science of the fear (الخوف) that animals experience: is it a natural or a Divine matter? And the description of the angels with fear: why did the angels fear their Lord from above them? For He, Exalted is He, is only feared due to what comes from Him, from the frightening causes above the angels. And which angels are described with fear: all of them or a type of them? And in it is the science of the governance of the single Spirit (الروح الواحدة) over many souls (نفوسا). From this, you know the Next Creation (النشأة الآخرة). And in it is the science of the magnification of punishment (العقوبة) upon the near one (المقرب), the possessor of the highest degree (الرتبة العليا). And why his degree did not protect him from punishment, and the difference between punishment (العقوبة), torment (العذاب), pain (الألم), and pains (الآلام). And in it is the science of the disputes and transgressions upon which souls are naturally disposed. And in it is the science of the purity of souls: is their purity essential (ذاتية) or acquired (مكتسبة)? And in it is the science of the merit of the two testimonies (الشهادتين), and what is praised of polytheism (الشرك) and what is blamed. And in it is the science of the degree of the believer compared to others, despite sharing in humanity, its necessities, and its definitions. And that by which the distinction occurred exists in every human being, because it is realized in the matter itself. So its relation to every human being is a single relation. Why then is the believer singled out by it over others? And in it is the science of the consideration of the cosmos by the great ones (الأكابر) apart from The Real: is that out of mercy for them, or is it due to weakness of nature (خور الطبع)? And in it is the science of the degree of the Divine Necessities (الواجبات الإلهية). And in it is the science of conditions, testimony, and judgments scattered throughout the world. And in it is the science of attribution to Allah, and who ought to be attributed to Allah, and by what means the attribution to Allah occurs that is beyond mere servitude (العبودة). And in it is a strange science: the descent of The Real (الحق) to the world in their attributes, or the ascent of the world to Allah with His attributes. For the matter concerning this is extremely obscure. Most Scholars of Allah say that The Real descended to the qualities of His servants, but the Realities (الحقائق) and Unveiling (الكشف) reject that. And in it is the science of the Prophetic Lights (الأنوار النبوية) derived from the Divine Glories (السبحات الإلهية), not the facial ones. And in it is the science of annulment (النقض) after confirmation (الإبرام): why was it confirmed in the first place? And in it is the science of specialization (الاختصاص) and its people, in the sensible and the intelligible. And in it is the science of the nearness and distance of souls from the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية). And in it is the science of restricting the great Scholars of Allah, and that their witnessing (شهودهم) is not used for judgment. And in it is the science of Divine Manners (الآداب الإلهية), and what Allah has veiled from His servants concerning gnoses (المعارف). And are the gnoses the same as the sciences (العلوم), or do their realities differ just as their names differ? And in it is the science of souls (النفوس) and spirits (الأرواح): are they one thing or do they differ? And in it is the science of the reason for which peace (السلام) appeared in every religion and among the angels. The Exalted said: <<سَلامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ بِما صَبَرْتُمْ>> (Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured). And in it is the science of the Divine Name The Patient (الصبور): does the Name The Forbearing (الحليم) have a ruling in it or not? And in it is the science of the reasons for the removal of harm (الأذى) from some parts of the world, and whether it is removed from the world such that it no longer has a ruling, or not. And in it is the science of the superiority of what is other than man over man: is it general in all respects, or is it superior to him in one thing, and he is superior to others in another thing? And what is the reason for that? And Allah <<يَقُولُ الْحَقَّ وهُوَ يَهْدِي السَّبِيلَ>> (speaks the Truth, and He guides to the way).

باب تین سو اکیاون: نفوس اور ارواح کے صفات میں اشتراک کے مقام کی معرفت میں، اور یہ اسم الودود سے متعلق غیرت محمدیہ (الغيرة المحمدية) کے حضور (الحضرة) سے ہے۔

بیشک مكمل (المكمل) کے لنگر نہیں ٹھہرتے،
پس کائنات میں اس کے لیے کوئی مقام نہیں جو اسے گھیرے۔
اس کا فلک تیرتا ہے اور ہوا اسے امید دلاتی ہے،
اور اللہ ہر حال میں اسے اس میں جاری رکھتا ہے۔
اور اس کے لیے کوئی بلند فلک نہیں جسے وہ کاٹ ڈالے،
پس جان لو جب تم اس میں کھڑے ہو تو کس سے سرگوشی کر رہے ہو۔
سب کچھ میرے اور اس کے لیے برابر ہے، پس جسے ہمارا خالق قریب کرے، میں ضرور اسے قریب کروں گا۔
اللہ کی قسم اے موسیٰ کی بہن! جلدی کرو اور میرے پرندے کا پر لے لو، پس اسے کاٹ ڈالو اور اسے کاٹ ڈالو۔

### [وہ ہی اول اور آخر اور ظاہر اور باطن ہے]
